attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
·           A stock take exercise was conducted on 19.05.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.

The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

ü  The following were the stock findings;

ü  Yeast -   -250g.

ü  Bread -    -49 loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -246 pieces

ü  All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·           The management to ensure that observed strong internal controls are adhered to.
attributes.effect: Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: ·           We will continue to maintain proper stock controls as observed.
Control is ok and will be maintained
Strong internal controls were noted for physical stock verified on 15/03/2025.
Current

·           A stock take exercise was conducted on 19.05.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
Dough weights sampled on 20.05.2025:(!st shift @10.00am)

Dough weights showed high underweight rate.
attributes.recommendation: ·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.
attributes.effect: + Underweight dough would result to underweight bread production which is against the company policy.

value: Underweight dough noted will continue to be addressed.
We will address underweight dough noted.
+ Dough weights sampled on 15.03.2025 showed several overweight pieces.
Previous
·         Sample varieties of dough  were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Set standard dough weight non-compliance was noted at the branch which could result to underweightbread production.
Operations/Production Department
+ To divide dough at set standard weights in order to achieve standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description: ·         Bread weights were sampled on 19/05/2025 and the following below were the results.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

 +  Noted high underweight bread especially for 800g bread should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
·         Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing and this is justified by high underweight dough rate noted.

·         Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence withholding revenues.

value: ·         Underweight bread noted will be addressed.
·         We will continue to sensitize staff on adherence set process flow in order to address bread weight extremes and ensure production of standard weight bread.
+ Bread weights sampled on 15.03.25 showed high underweight bread rate for 400g CT white and 400g Ct brown varieties and high overweight rate for 800g white bread.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of  packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Bread weight extremes showed non-compliance to set bread weight policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 01/05/2025 - 18/05/2025.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

+ maintaining bread damages within the tolerable rates is commendable.

value: We will put more efforts to ensure that bread damages are further reduced.
+ Bread damages will further be controlled to minimal levels.
+ March 2025 audit report highlighted controlled bread damages as analyzed from 01.02.25 – 28.02.2025.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ Adherence to managing bread damages within the tolerable rate was noted. This ensures revenue targets are realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that bread damages are within the tolerable rate.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis
attributes.description:
·          Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.05.25 – 18.05.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

Below are the summary of the findings

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: + Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

value: + Daily verification of mixing chart summaries and SAP stock analysis is done to ensure that the data is matching.
+ Data accuracy will always be ensured with actual consumptions being reflected on production records.
·          Accurate data transfer from manual production records to SAP system was noted as analyzed from 01.02.25 – 28.02.25. This is per March 2025 audit report.
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.05.25 – 18.05.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Data transfer was accurate both from mixing charts to summaries and to SAP system. This shows accountability of items issued and produced product.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring accurate production data transfer from source document to the SAP system.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 19.05.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The Table below illustrates the transactions;
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect: + Low risk of cash, bread and crates loss.

value: + Noted mini shop controls to be maintained.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+ Mini shop spot check on 15/03/2025 showed that set SOPs were adhered to.
Previous
+ A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Mini shop SOPs were observed.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring accountability of all bread transferred to the mini shop.

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis
attributes.description:
·          From 01/05/2024 – 18/05/2025, aggregate yield (after conversion to 400g) ranged from 191.45 – 192.45lvs/bag, with an average of 192.11lvs/bag.

·          From 1,577bags, total yield expected was 302,936pcs (upon conversion to 400g) and 302,936pcs was reflected on production records. Thus expected yields realized.

·          Breakdown of yields for the various bread varieties is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: + Adhering to set standard yields is commendable.

value: + we always ensure that set standard yields are adhered to.
+ We will maintain the noted trend of adhering to set standard yields.
+ March 2025 report highlighted that set yields were achieved as per set BOM.
Previous

+ The exercise was conducted to determine if resulting yields for each variety matched expected yields (as per set BOMs) and also establish the consistency. Low yields than expected would be translated as concealing of actual yields denying the company revenues.
+ Set bread yield standards were adhered to hence compliance to set BOM.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set standard bread yields.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Analysis was done from 01/05/2025 - 18/05/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;

Set production efficiency was realized.
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to set production efficiency is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Production costs were checked through adherence to set production efficiency standard.

value: + We will put efforts to ensure this is maintained.
+ We will always align to set production efficiency policy.
+ March 2025 audit report highlighted that production efficiency was 4.55bags/staff as analyzed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25.
Current
·          This test was conducted to determine if set production  efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ The branch management complied with set production efficiency standard.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set production efficiency standard.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description: ·          Packing efficiency (01/05/2025 – 18/05/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          Noted packing inefficiency should be addressed.

·          Surplus wage payment due to production and packing inefficiency should be surcharged.
attributes.effect: + packing inefficiency led to increased production costs.

value: ·          We will put in measures to ensure set packing efficiency targets are realized.
• We will put in stringent measures to address operational inefficiencies noted.
• March 2025 audit report highlighted production and packing inefficiency as analyzed from 01.02.25 – 28.02.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Packing efficiency was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.

+ Set packing efficiency standard was not realized.

+ There was non-compliance to set packing efficiency policy.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set packing efficiency is achieved.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description: ·           Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/04/2025 – 30/04/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table.
attributes.recommendation: + Economical fuel consumption for sales vans is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Economical fuel consumption imply that operations costs were checked.

value: + Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
+ Economical fuel consumption will always be ensured.
+ March 2025 audit report noted economical fuel consumption for motor vehicles.
Previous

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans and generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Fuel consumption by sales vans was economical.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring fuel consumption by sales vans is as per standard fuel consumption for each vehicle.
